required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pratical Assessment of DSAEK in the Management of Endothelial Decompensation Following Penetrating Keratoplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Pratical Assessment of Descemet'Sstripping Automated Endothelial Keratoplasty (DSAEK) in the Management of Endothelial Decompensation Following Penetrating Keratoplasty

brief_summary.textblock: Reporting our anatomical and functional results and the possible complications of the first six Descemet's stripping endothelial keratoplasty (DSAEK) performed in our department secondary to endothelial decompensation after penetrating keratoplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective and observational monocentric study fo six patients with DSAEK after prior penetrating keratoplasty (PK). The data collected are: demographic characteristics, ophthalmological comorbidities, initial indication of PK, delay between PK and DSAEK. Preoperative Visual Acuity and at 1, 3 and 6 months postoperative were collected in logmar for analysis. The central cornea and graft thickness measured in OCT as well as the postoperative complications were also collected.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from visual acuity at 6 month
primary_outcome.description: pre and postoperative visual acuity in logmar

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from cornea thickness at 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: the central cornea and graft thickness measured in OCT
all the postoperative complications were collected

study_pop.textblock: Patients who profited of the first Descemet's stripping endothelial keratoplasty to endothelial decompensation after penetrating keratoplasty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- with endothelial decompensation after penetrating keratoplasty
- surgery realised by the same surgeon
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
